intro: Elytropappus gnaphaloides, commonly known as the silverleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, often hairy foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically silver-gray in color, giving it a distinctive appearance and making it popular in ornamental gardening. Elytropappus gnaphaloides is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for dryland environments.
